alert.note: Alert for South Washington Coast (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued February 28 at 2:35PM PST until February 28 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Tidal overflow flooding. * WHERE...In Washington, South Washington Coast. In Oregon, North Oregon Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to one foot above ground level, during high tides is expected in the low lying areas near bays, sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Toke Point gauge expected to reach 11.1 ft around midday Monday. Astoria, OR gauge expected to reach 10.3 ft around midday Monday.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property.
